Old Definition: A document that explains all relevant study information to assist a human subject in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a research study. This form document is presented to and signed by the study subject.

Old Definition: an informed consent rule specification that specifies a course of action legally required to be taken. An example is that the organization leading a study is obliged to destroy the patient's biospecimens after 10 years as required in an informed consent form.
New Definition: an informed consent rule specification that specifies a course of action legally required to be taken. An example is that the organization leading a study is obliged to destroy the patient's biospecimens after 10 years as required in an informed consent form.

Old Definition: an informed consent rule specification that specifies an optional course of action that is an option for a participant to take. An example is that a human subject consenter is given the option to withdraw from a consented study any time as specified in an informed consent form.

New Definition: a data item consisting of a unique identification code designating an informed consent.

New Definition: A role that inheres in human being and is an output of some participation in a research study.

Old Definition: The documentation that is the output of an authorization process.

Old Definition: A benefit is a disposition or the potential positive effects that may arise from participatiing in a study.

Old Definition: A benefit is a disposition or the potential positive effects that may arise from participatiing in a study.
New Definition: A benefit is a disposition or the potential positive effects that may arise from participatiing in a study.

Old Definition: A risk is a disposition or the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
New Definition: A risk is a disposition or the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

Old Definition: A risk is a disposition or the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
New Definition: A risk is a disposition or the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

Old Definition: A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.
New Definition: A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.

Old Definition: A role that inheres in an individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.
New Definition: A role that inheres in an individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.

Old Definition: All "individually identifiable health information" held or transmitted by a covered entity or its business associate, in any form or media, whether electronic, paper, or oral.
New Definition: All "individually identifiable health information" held or transmitted by a covered entity or its business associate, in any form or media, whether electronic, paper, or oral.

Old Label: informed consent process with assenting process
New Label: informed consent process with assenting process
Old Definition: An informed consent process that has an assent process as a proper part. This process has a participant of a parent or a legally authorized representative on behalf of a child and an adult who lacks the capacity to consent.
New Definition: An informed consent process that has an assent process as a proper part.

Old Definition: a role that inheres in a patient or the legal guadian when he/she participates the consenting process.
New Definition: A deontic role that is output of some Act of Consent and, in some contexts, may be realized in revoking or modifying the permission role that was output of the same Act of Consent.

Old Definition: The measured temporal interval of a study.
New Definition: A time measurement datum of a study period.

Old Definition: a temporal interval that represent the time of someone (for example the study subject) participating the study or the research.
New Definition: A temporal interval that represent the time of a human being participates in a procedure or study

Old Label: actual duration of study subject participation
New Label: actual duration of study subject participation
Old Definition: Total length of time of subject's participation in a clinical study; from the time of enrollment to the completion of follow-up.
New Definition: Total length of time of subject's participation in a clinical study; from the time of enrollment to the completion of follow-up.

Old Definition: A document that certifies that 1) a person may perform some action, or 2) which provides authentication for a claim, or 3) which confirms position or status.
New Definition: A document that certifies that 1) a person may perform some action, or 2) which provides authentication for a claim, or 3) which confirms position or status.

Old Definition: The probability and magnitude of harm or discomfort anticipated in the research are not greater in and of themselves than those ordinarily encountered in daily life or during the performance of routine physical or psychological examinations or tests
New Definition: A risk that is equal or lesser than those ordinarily encountered in daily life or during the performance of routine physical or psychological examinations or tests.

Old Definition: a medical record that records a patient's mental health care history.
New Definition: a medical record that records a patient's mental health care history.

Old Definition: a physical injury or illness that is a direct result of the treatment, or procedures required by the protocol, to which the subject would not have been exposed had they not participated in the study.
New Definition: a physical injury or illness that is a direct result of the treatment, or procedures required by the protocol, to which the subject would not have been exposed had they not participated in the study.

Old Definition: The personal identifiable information that is about a human subject that enrolled in a study.
New Definition: The personal identifiable information that is about a human subject that enrolled in a study.

Old Definition:
“Individually identifiable health information” is information, including demographic data, that relates to: 1)the individual’s past, present or future physical or mental health or condition, 2) the provision of health care to the individual, or 3) the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health care to the individual, and that identifies the individual or for which there is a reasonable basis to believe it can be used to identify the individual.
Individually identifiable health information includes many common identifiers (e.g., name, address, birth date, Social Security Number).
New Definition:
“Individually identifiable health information” is information, including demographic data, that relates to: 1)the individual’s past, present or future physical or mental health or condition, 2) the provision of health care to the individual, or 3) the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health care to the individual, and that identifies the individual or for which there is a reasonable basis to believe it can be used to identify the individual.
Individually identifiable health information includes many common identifiers (e.g., name, address, birth date, Social Security Number).

Old Definition: Legal name is the person name that identifies a person for legal, administrative and other official purposes. A person's first legal name generally is the name of the person that was given for the purpose of registration of the birth and which then appears on a birth certificate (see birth name), but may change subsequently.
New Definition: Legal name is the person name that identifies a person for legal, administrative and other official purposes. A person's first legal name generally is the name of the person that was given for the purpose of registration of the birth and which then appears on a birth certificate (see birth name), but may change subsequently.

Old Definition: a process that terminates a study.
New Definition: a process that terminates a study.

Old Definition: a planned process that represents a study participant withdrawing from a study.
New Definition: A planned process in which an agent ceases participation in a study.

Old Definition: A treatment currently in wide use and approved by FDA or other health authority, considered to be effective in the treatment of a specific disease or condition.
New Definition: A treatment currently in wide use and approved by a regulatory body or health authority, considered to be effective in the treatment of a specific disease or condition.

Old Definition: A character string that is assigned by the review board upon approval of the study.
New Definition: A character string that is assigned by a review board upon approval of the study.

Old Definition: data administration is an organizational function working in the areas of information systems and computer science that plans, organizes, describes and controls data resources.
New Definition: An organizational function that a) involves the areas of information systems and computer science; and that b) plans, organizes, describes, and controls data resources.

Old Definition: a data item that has been processed to make it impossible to know the person with whom the data are associated.
New Definition: A data item that has been processed to prevent the identification of the person with whom the data are associated.

Old Definition: anonoymized data that is about a genomic sample.
New Definition: anonoymized data that is about a genomic sample.

Old Definition: a planned process that involves in the usage of data generated out of a human subject participation.
New Definition: A planned process that involves in the usage of data which was an output of a human being's participation in a study.

Old Label: repository of signed informed consent forms
Old Definition: A site where signed informed consent forms are physically perserved.
New Definition: A site where documents are preserved.

Old Label: US federal policy for the protection of human subjects
New Label: US federal policy for the protection of human subjects

New Definition: a directive information entity that specifies US federal policy for the protection of human subjects.

Old Label: planned duration of study subject participation
New Label: planned duration of study subject participation

New Definition: a participation time that is the total length of time of subject's participation in a research study; from the time of enrollment to the completion of follow-up.

Old Label: planned duration of study subject participation

New Definition: a participation time that is the total length of time of subject's participation in a research study; from the time of enrollment to the completion of follow-up.

Old Definition: A review board approval number that is assigned by an Institutional Review Board (IRB) in the USA.
New Definition: A review board approval number that is assigned by an Institutional Review Board (IRB) in the USA.

Old Definition: an informed consent form that is used for vaccination
New Definition: An informed consent form that contains sections specific to procedures in vaccination.

Old Definition: A questionaire that lists the questions associated with a participant or human subject's eligibility. The answers of these eligibility questions will determine if the participant is eligible for participation in a study or operation.
New Definition: A questionnaire with a set of questions and choices which help identify an eligibility criterion (OBI_05000026), such that the answers to these questions enable determination whether or not the person is eligible to participate.

Old Definition: a textual entity that provides a question in text.
New Definition: A textual entity that presents a question or specifies a prompt to which one may answer.

Old Definition: A planned process that results in a legally effective consent status
New Definition: A planned process that results in a legally effective consent status

Old Definition: A planned process where a child who is unable to give true informed consent before a certain age agrees to participate.
New Definition: A planned process of acknowledgement (or agreement) to participate in a procedure or study, where the participant is incapable of informed consent.

Old Definition: A role that inheres in a human being who participates in a consenting process and eventually becomes legally effectively consented.
New Definition: A role that inheres in a human being who participates in a consenting process and eventually becomes legally effectively consented.

Old Label: consenting to postmortem donation of specified anatomical entities
Old Definition: An informed consent for a person to allow postmortem collection of specimens derived from specified anatomical entities that is the outcome of an informed consent process that occurs after death of the donor and has donor family members as participants.
New Definition: A planned process in which an agent's designated biological specimen is collected after the death of the agent.

Old Definition: A planned process in which an agent's designated biological specimen is collected after the death of the agent.
New Definition: A planned process in which an agent's designated biological specimen is collected after the death of the agent.

Old Definition: a role inhering in a participant who meets all eligibility criteria defined within a study protocol
New Definition: a role inhering in a participant who meets all eligibility criteria defined within a study protocol

Old Definition: a role inhering in a participant who does not meet all eligibility criteria defined within the study protocol
New Definition: a role inhering in a participant who does not meet all eligibility criteria defined within the study protocol

Old Label: consenting to be contacted for future research
New Label: act of contact for future research

New Definition: A planned process in which an agent contacts the participant regarding opportunities related to future research.

Old Label: act of contact for future research
New Label: act of contact for future research
Old Definition: A planned process in which an agent contacts the participant regarding opportunities related to future research.
New Definition: A planned process in which an agent contacts the participant regarding opportunities related to future research.

Old Definition: A planned process to screen the eligibility of a candidate for a study, whcih is usually done against one or more protocols.
New Definition: A planned process to screen the eligibility of a candidate for a study or procedure, verifying whether certain sufficient or necessary conditions for eligibility obtain.

Old Definition: A planned process that a person agrees to participate in a research project, which is a part of an informed consent process.
New Definition: A planned process that a person agrees to participate in a research project, which is a part of an informed consent process.

Old Definition: An informed consent by an adult subject who is capable of giving permission to participate in a research study and who is capable of providing consent.
New Definition: An informed consent process that involves an adult who consents.

Old Definition: An informed consent by the parent/guardian of a child or a minor to consent to give a permission for the child/minor to be included in research.
New Definition: An informed consent by the parent on behalf of a child or a minor to give a permission for the child or minor to participate in study or procedure.

Old Definition: A planned process that a person denies to participate in a research project.
New Definition: A planned process that a person denies to participate in a research project.

Old Definition: An informed consent by a participant to verbally read the elements and verbally agrees to participate. Verbal consent still contains all elements of written consent.
New Definition: An informed consent process in which the participant communicates consent orally rather than by filling out and signing a written form.

Old Definition: An informed consent when there is a language barrier and an English IRB-approved consent is orally translated in the subject’s native language.
New Definition: An informed consent process in which the pariticipant is not competent to read and write in the language of the informed consent form, but is competent to consent with the aid of a translation into the agent's native language.

Old Label: consenting to collection of biological samples
Old Definition: An informed consent for the collection of biological sample from a subject.

New Definition: A planned process in which a biological sample from a subject is collected for testing.

Old Definition: An informed consent for the collection of some tissue samples from a subject.
New Definition: A planned process in which a tissue sample from a subject is collected for testing.

New Definition: A planned process in which a tissue sample from a subject is collected for testing.

Old Definition: An informed consent for the collection of a blood sample from a subject.

New Definition: A planned process in which a blood sample from a subject is collected for testing.

New Definition: A deontic role that if realized is realized by its bearer conducting or overseeing genetic research on the genome of a human donor.

Old Definition: A deontic declaration that has permittee role to do genetic research on a human donor as a specified outcome.
New Definition: A deontic declaration that has permittee role to do genetic research on a human donor as a specified outcome.

Old Definition: a role that inheres in a human subject who participates in a process of granting assent.
New Definition: A role that inheres in an individual as an output of an informed assent process.

Old Definition: a textual entity that provides an option of an answer for a person to select.
New Definition: A textual entity that specifies a chosen option among multiple options presented.

Old Definition: an answer option textual entity that answers a question with a yes.
New Definition: A filled multiple choice text entity that specifies an affirmative option.

Old Definition: an answer option textual entity that answers a question with a no.
New Definition: A filled multiple choice text entity that specifies a negative option.

New Label: consenting to not to have financial benefit

New Definition: An informed consent for a subject agrees not to have financial benefit in the future.

New Label: consenting to not to be informed about incidental finding

Old Definition: An informed consent for an unspecified range of future research subject to a few content or process restrictions.
